article.headline: Oklahoma State 93, SE Oklahoma State 46
article.story: STILLWATER, Okla. (AP) -- Southeastern Oklahoma State got a payout, some good publicity and blown out of the gym. Ivan McFarlin scored 19 points and Daniel Bobik added 16 to lead Oklahoma State past the Division II Savages 93-46 Tuesday night. John Lucas had 10 points and 11 assists and six Cowboys scored in double figures as Oklahoma State (5-1) rebounded from a 76-71 loss to BYU 10 days ago that knocked it out of the AP Top 25. "We haven't played for a week and a half, so we just tried to come out and take out some of our frustration of the loss," Bobik said. Jason Stampley led the Savages (6-3) with 12 points. It was Southeastern Oklahoma State's first game against a Division I opponent since both schools met in 1939. The Savages received about $10,000 for the game, about half of the team's annual budget. "We approached it like a fun type of game in which we just wanted to get better," Southeastern Oklahoma State coach Tony Robinson said. "We challenged ourselves at halftime that, no matter what the score was, we wanted to keep running our stuff." Southeastern Oklahoma State led only once, at 4-3 just 1:39 into the game and could only keep it close for about five minutes. Leading just 16-12 with 14:44 remaining in the first half, the Cowboys intensified their defense, forcing 10 turnovers and blocking six shots. Oklahoma State outscored the Savages 40-10 from there to lead 56-22 at the half. Tony Allen had five points on a dunk and a 3-pointer and Stephen Graham and McFarlin added four points in the Cowboys' 15-0 run over 3:17 that made it 49-19. Oklahoma State outrebounded the Savages 46-27, including a 20-8 advantage on the offensive glass. Against BYU, the Cougars grabbed 26 more rebounds than the Cowboys. "Coach reminded us that rebounding wins games," said McFarlin, who also led Oklahoma State with 10 boards. The Cowboys continued to pour it on in the second half. Joey Graham's layup off an assist by Bobik gave Oklahoma State its largest lead at 89-40 with 3:01 remaining.
